Package com.lambdaschool.crudyrestaurants.services

Interface RestaurantServices

All Known Implementing Classes:
RestaurantServicesImpl
public interface RestaurantServices
The Service that works with the Restaurant Model.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void delete​(long id)
    Deletes the restaurant record and its menu items from the database based off of the provided primary key
    void deleteAllRestaurants()
    Deletes are records
    java.util.List<Restaurant> findAllRestaurants()
    Returns a list of all the restaurants.
    java.util.List<Restaurant> findByDish​(java.lang.String thedish)
    A list of all restaurants whose menu contains the given dish
    java.util.List<Restaurant> findByNameLike​(java.lang.String thename)
    A list of all restaurants whose name contains the given substring.
    java.util.List<Restaurant> findByState​(java.lang.String state)
    A list of all restaurants in a given state.
    Restaurant findRestaurantById​(long id)
    Returns the restaurant with the given primary key.
    Restaurant findRestaurantByName​(java.lang.String name)
    Returns the restaurant with the given name
    java.util.List<MenuCounts> getMenuCounts()
    A list of all restaurants with their number of menus items
    Restaurant save​(Restaurant restaurant)
    Given a complete restaurant object, saves that restaurant object in the database.
    Restaurant update​(Restaurant restaurant, long id)
    Updates the provided fields in the restaurant record referenced by the primary key.

  • Method Details

    • findAllRestaurants

      java.util.List<Restaurant> findAllRestaurants()
      Returns a list of all the restaurants.
      Returns:
      List of Restaurant. If no Restaurant, empty list.

    • findRestaurantById

      Restaurant findRestaurantById​(long id)
      Returns the restaurant with the given primary key.
      Parameters:
      id - The primary key (long) of the restaurant you seek.
      Returns:
      The given Restaurant or throws an exception if not found.

    • findRestaurantByName

      Restaurant findRestaurantByName​(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the restaurant with the given name
      Parameters:
      name - The full name (String) of the Restaurant you seek.
      Returns:
      The Restaurant with the given name or throws an exception if not found.

    • findByState

      java.util.List<Restaurant> findByState​(java.lang.String state)
      A list of all restaurants in a given state.
      Parameters:
      state - The two character (String) abbreviation of the state you seek.
      Returns:
      List of Restaurant from that state. If no matching Restaurant, empty list.

    • findByNameLike

      java.util.List<Restaurant> findByNameLike​(java.lang.String thename)
      A list of all restaurants whose name contains the given substring.
      Parameters:
      thename - The substring (String) of name you wish to search for.
      Returns:
      A list of all restaurants whose name contains the given substring. If no matching Restaurant, empty list.

    • findByDish

      java.util.List<Restaurant> findByDish​(java.lang.String thedish)
      A list of all restaurants whose menu contains the given dish
      Parameters:
      thedish - The substring (String) of the dish you seek
      Returns:
      A list of all restaurants whose menu contains the given substring. If no matching Restaurant, empty list.

    • getMenuCounts

      java.util.List<MenuCounts> getMenuCounts()
      A list of all restaurants with their number of menus items
      Returns:
      A list of all restaurants with their number of menus items.

    • delete

      void delete​(long id)
      Deletes the restaurant record and its menu items from the database based off of the provided primary key
      Parameters:
      id - id The primary key (long) of the restaurant you seek.

    • update

      Restaurant update​(Restaurant restaurant, long id)
      Updates the provided fields in the restaurant record referenced by the primary key.

      Regarding Payment and Menu items, this process only allows adding those. Deleting and editing those lists is done through a separate endpoint.

      Parameters:
      restaurant - just the restaurant fields to be updated.
      id - The primary key (long) of the restaurant to update
      Returns:
      the complete restaurant object that got updated

    • save

      Restaurant save​(Restaurant restaurant)
      Given a complete restaurant object, saves that restaurant object in the database. If a primary key is provided, the record is completely replaced If no primary key is provided, one is automatically generated and the record is added to the database.
      Parameters:
      restaurant - the restaurant object to be saved
      Returns:
      the saved restaurant object including any automatically generated fields

    • deleteAllRestaurants

      void deleteAllRestaurants()
      Deletes are records
